timeline.bodyText: Why not return a boolean here instead of throwing an exception?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText:
To make it the same as removeAndRestoreDataBundle. The latter needs to be String-returning as there is a usage in L&P test case that requires it to be. And I do think there might be future usage of putDocuments that requires the output result, but I could be wrong.
Going by the YAGNI principle I could revert this back to boolean-returning, but I do think it's fine either way.
replies.author: wkurniawan07
rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: Why is there a println here?
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText: You'd want to know why it fails.
replies.author: wkurniawan07

timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

timeline.bodyText: This is not related to this PR but catching all Exception is rarely a good choice. It is much better to catch the specific ones that you know will be thrown and handle them.
timeline.author: rrtheonlyone

replies.bodyText:
Rarely does not mean always. In this case:

This is a test only method. That on its own doesn't justify to be lazy and catch all Exceptions, but the next reason will/should.
Any kind of failure during persisting search documents (or test data, because the methodology of catching-all-Exceptions are the same) warrant the same handling: retry or halt (depending on number of attempts), i.e. no special case needs to be handled differently. If each case is caught separately but in the end everything is handled the same, that becomes a case of "doing it just for the sake of doing it", which is an anti-pattern.
replies.author: wkurniawan07
